tutorial.speak:
Let's export your data from B1.church Admin. First, in the B1.church Admin dashboard, click on the Settings icon.
In the Settings page, click on the Import/Export button to access the import and export tool.
You'll see Step 1 - Import Source. Click on the Data Source dropdown to choose your data source.
Select "B1 Database" from the dropdown menu to export your B1 church data.
This takes you to Step 2 - Preview. Here you can see a preview of the data that will be exported, including people, groups, attendance, donations, and forms. Click "Continue to Destination" to proceed.
You'll now be at Step 3 - Choose Export Destination. Click on the Export Destination dropdown.
Select "B1 Export Zip" to create a zip file containing all your exported data.
Step 4 shows the Export Progress. You'll see green check marks as each section completes. This includes campuses, people, photos, groups, donations, attendance, forms, and more. Please wait for the process to finish without closing your browser.
When the export is complete, the Recent Download History will show your downloaded B1Export file. The zip file will automatically download to your downloads folder.
Open your downloads folder and locate the B1Export zip file. Unzip the file to see the contents. You'll find multiple CSV files for different data types, along with any exported photos.
Open any CSV file, such as people.csv, with Excel or Numbers. This contains your exported data with all the information you can now use for reporting, analysis, or importing into another system.
